title: The Smarter Way to Clean Your Home
text:
Cleaning is the kind of necessary evil that just has to be done. But imagine if all you had to do was press a button or tap your smartphone?



The latest group of intelligent cleaning devices leaves the dirty work to technology and a sparkling space in every wake.



Here, a roundup of some of the hottest home systems on the market.



Gladwell Gecko Robot Window Cleaner



Gladwell Gecko Robot Window Cleaner

Forget about precariously balancing on a ladder. The Gladwell Gecko Robot Window Cleaner uses a suction technology to attach and stay put on your window and has an attached rope, so it (rather than you) can be maneuvered from the ground. Controlled via mobile app, the device deep cleans and instinctively detects edges to make sure every part of the window is scrubbed clean. And, the microfiber cleaning pads are machine washable, so you can reuse them.



The Gladwell Gecko Robot Window Cleaner is available for $160.



Brilliant Pad Self-Cleaning Automatic Indoor Dog Potty

Brilliant Pad Self-Cleaning Automatic Indoor Dog Potty

Any pet parent with a pup that goes on a pad knows, it’s a dirty business. From the smell to the cleanup to the near misses, potty pads can stink—literally. Enter Brilliant Pad Self-Cleaning Automatic Indoor Dog Potty, a system (for dogs under 25 pounds) that cleans itself so you don’t have to even go near the mess. It works like a regular potty pad with the major benefit of automatically swapping out and wrapping up a dirty roll. Once the pad roll is used up, you remove it entirely, rod and caps included, and throw it away—it’s made with biodegradable materials, so you never have to feel guilty about tossing it.



The Brilliant Pad Self-Cleaning Automatic Indoor Dog Potty is available for $150.



iAquaLink Polaris 9650iQ Sport

iAquaLink Polaris 9650iQ Sport

The iAquaLink Polaris 9650iQ Sport eliminates the need for the old-school scoop-and- dump pool cleaning system—that requires a person and a net—and replaces it with an automatic methodology. The four-wheel-drive robotic cleaner is controlled via an accompanying app through Wi-Fi from your smartphone, so you don’t even have to step foot outside or even be home for that matter. It has a state-of-the art vacuum system that suctions up debris as well as a rear water propulsion system that allows the cleaner to reach grime under stairs and hard-to-reach corners. Debris can be easily removed from the top of the cleaner, which features a large canister.

The iAquaLink Polaris 9650iQ Sport is available for $1.000.



iRobot Braava 380T Floor Mopping Robot

iRobot Braava 380T Floor Mopping Robot

When your floors needs a deep clean, the iRobot Braava 380T Floor Mopping Robot is exactly the device to restore them to their former gleaming glory. The system has built-in navigation that works like an indoor GPS to help chart its course. There are different modes, such as dry sweep or damp mop, to suit all your cleaning needs. It works well on all hard-surface floors and can cover large areas. All you need to do is attach a cloth and press the button for your mode of choice. It’ll do all the rest and even power down by itself.



iRobot Braava 380T Floor Mopping Robot is available for $300.



Sonic Soak Ultrasonic Cleaning Tool

Sonic Soak Ultrasonic Cleaning Tool

For the bacteria phobic, the Sonic Soak Ultrasonic Cleaning Tool deploys 50,000 ultrasonic vibrations per second to break down dirt molecules and deep clean everything from makeup brushes and clothing to blankets, fruit and eyeglasses. The multi-purpose cleaning device banishes dirt and bacteria at a microscopic level and uses 40 times less water and 15 times less energy than standard washing machines. All you have to do is fill your sink or a bowl with water, plug in the unit, put your dirty items along with the device in the water, set the timer and let it work its magic.



The Sonic Soak Ultrasonic Cleaning Tool is available for $150.



ikuddle

ikuddle

Most cat owners concur minding the litter box is a high maintenance (and messy) undertaking. But the ikuddle is an odor-free, completely enclosed self-cleaning system. After your cat does her business inside the box, you can initiate cleanup from the ikuddle app on your smartphone, which separates the waste from the clean litter for you. You’ll receive a notification once it’s complete. Then, tap the auto-packing button on the app to automatically seal the waste into a small bag, so you can toss when you’re ready. The smart system even monitors how often your cat uses the litter box, detects when she’s entering or leaving, and reduces litter usage by up to 30%.



The ikuddle is available for $309.
